JobTitle: Associate Antenna RF Engineer / Passive Microwave Engineer
JobFullDesc: Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.Boeing Defense, Space, and Security (BDS) In-Space Vehicles Engineering, located in El Segundo, CA, is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Associate Antenna RF Engineer / Passive Microwave Engineer (Level 2).  As an Antenna RF Engineer, you will work on satellite antenna/payload products and capabilities that help our customers to meet their mission requirements.  The specific products you will work on will be Antenna feed assemblies and Passive Microwave units.Responsibilities may include but are not limited to the following:  Assists in developing and validating requirements for various communication, sensor, electronic warfare and other electromagnetic systems and components.Assists in the development and validation of electromagnetic requirements for electrical\electronic systems, mechanical systems, interconnects and structures.Assists in developing architectures to integrate components into higher level systems and platforms.Performs trade studies, modeling, simulation and other forms of analysis to predict component and interconnects performance and to optimize design around established requirements.Defines and conducts simple tests to validate performance of designs to requirements.Collects and analyzes data on supplier and partner performance to ensure compliance to requirements.Provides support to products throughout their lifecycle from manufacturing to customer use by recommending engineering solutions to issues.Supports project management by preparing and presenting project status data.Writes simple sections of proposals to support development of new business.Works under general supervision.Security Clearances:This position requires the ability to obtain U.S. Security Clearance, for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. A Tier 5 (T5) (formerly known as a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) Clearance Post-Start is required. Basic Qualifications:Technical B.S. degree in electrical engineering (with antenna/ electromagnetics emphasis) to provide a solid technical foundationAn understanding of basic Antenna feed components (horns, filters, diplexers) is required2+ years of experience of electromagnetic principles as related to antenna engineering is required2+ years of experience of basic design principles of Antenna Feed components and be experienced in performing trade studies to determine the best design choices for a particular application.Candidate should have demonstrated skills in Antenna Feed component RF measurements to validate product compliance including standard network analyzer measurements, Far Field and Near Field pattern measurementsCandidate shall demonstrate the ability to recognize inconsistencies in measured data (whether data is from internal sources or provided by a vendor) and provide guidance measurement techniquesPreferred Qualifications: Demonstrated experience (>2 years) with Antenna Feed design assembly and testThe candidate must be able to communicate effectively and concisely to a broad audience (peers, Program Managers, customers)Candidate shall exhibit  the organizational skills necessary to summarize and present Antenna Feed data to a broad audience and be able to communicate clearly the fundamentals of the dataThe candidate must demonstrate operational excellence within the antenna organization and be capable of working with individuals across multiple disciplines to complete the assembly and test of Antenna FeedsTypical Education/Experience:Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.Relocation:This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility. Note: Basic relocation will be offered for eligible internal candidates.For further information on the basic relocation plan, refer here.Drug Free Workplace:Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.Qualifications
